intro: Asemeia violacea, commonly known as the violetleaf asemeia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Asemeia violacea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
